captions.text:
Hey Vsauce3, Michael here, and because Vsauce3
is about games, I figured I'd share some things
that you can Do Online Now, Guys: Dong's.

Now, first thing's first, in case you ever
find yourself bored in the real world, you

should be prepared. Randomidea.com has you
covered. For instance, gather up all of your

junk mail and return it to the sender. Or,
put plastic cups in a chain link fence and
spell out a message.

But if you control is more your thing, play
this traffic game, sent by Osacada12345, where

you control traffic lights and let through
a certain number of cars within a time limit.
Seems simple because it is...addictive.

Honeycloud.net shows other people trying to
control...the internet. You can watch cyber

attacks in realtime, around the world. The
red dots represent attacks, and the yellow

dots are honeypots, or sensors, which monitor
and publish the flow of cyber attacks. What

it shows is a bit skewed because there are
more sensors in certain areas of the world,

and fewer in others, but it makes you wonder,
should you make everything ok? .com...

Phew, ok, moving on. ParanoidDeath321 brings
us Amorphous +. You have the kill different

Glooples before they kill you. Ah, at least
they give you a giant knife the get the job

done. Now, different types pose different
threats, such as the Meltie, which throws

acid, or the Oozle which surrounds you in
goo...both of which kill you.

On the safer side is MCyclopedia's Plink,
it's an interactive music-maker where you

get to make sounds with other people in real
time. Change the sound you make with the colors

on the left, and then use the scale by moving
your mouse up and down.

But let's get serious. Would you rather have
an attractive spouse who treats you badly,

or an ugly spouse that adores you? Or would
you rather be on jury duty, or go to work?

At YouRather.com, you can answer these questions
and see how weird you are by comparing your

answers to what everyone says that they would
do.

On the educational side is this interactive
map of the world. You can zoom in to anywhere

on the map and click to see what wikipedia
has to say about it. For instance, uh, St.
Winifred's Church. Tadaaa.

Wait, wait...What time is it?? Well with this
cool ring clock, you can see seconds, minutes,

hours, days, and months pass and fill in the
rings. But if time truly is your thing, you

must check out Time.is- one of the most accurate
and detailed ways of figuring out exactly
what time it is.

On Soundcloud you can listen to music and
see comments people have put in at certain

points in the song. But Mr. Doob has come
up with a brilliant way to put them all together,

and turn the comments into a visualization.
I'm also a fan of this construction of his-

the deformity follows around your mouse, and
you can click for a new one.

Make music with balls...Or, some instant origami.
But if you want to escape it all, try the

game Escape, like Zelete Android where you
have to escape death from lasers and being

electrocuted. Or try escaping death by spike
in Rag Doll Avalanche. Throw him around before

he gets cut in half, which is harder than
it looks.

If you do well, make yourself a slogan at
SloganMaker.com. "It's Michael Stevens." "More

smiles with Michael Stevens." Or, how about
"You can count on Vsauce." And, always remember,
"There's a bit of Vsauce in all of us."

That's true...Sub Reddits. There are more
amazing Sub Reddits out there than you could

ever fit into one video, but, for now, I want
to focus on the inspiration of Old School

Cool and ChannelWatch. ChannelWatch is kind
of like /videos, except it focuses not on

one-off, often viral videos, but, instead,
on channels- places where you can feel pretty

happy subscribing, knowing that consistent
content will be delivered.

Finally, if you want more DONG's, look no
further than InternetIsBeautiful. It's one
of my favorites.
Enjoy, and, as always, thanks for watching.

title: CYBER ATTACK MAP And 17 Other DONGs
